channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil prices bounce after 2-day pullback as investors monitor Middle East
item.description: Oil futures rose Thursday, bouncing after a two-day pullback, with support tied to continued worries over the potential for a more direct confrontatio...

item.title: U.S. Stock Indexes Slip After CPI Inflation Comes In a Touch Hot
item.description: Stocks inched lower at the open. Investors are paying close attention both to the labor market, and to progress in taming inflation, given the implica...

item.title: Treasury Yields Rise on Inflation, Labor Data
item.description: Treasury yields rose after both U.S. inflation and jobless claims climbed higher than expected.

item.title: ‘It’s so unfair!’ I’m miserable in my job. I’m 58 and have $1 million in a 401(k) and Roth IRA. Can I afford to quit?
item.description: “Currently, I live comfortably on $5,000 a month, but I could probably live on $3,500 a month.”

item.title: Higher 10-year Treasury yields were enemy No. 1 for markets for years. Why now looks different.
item.description: The 10-year Treasury yield’s recent climb above the psychologically important 4% level might not be as big of a threat to the stock market — or the U....

item.title: Dollar Strengthens on Inflation, Labor Data
item.description: The dollar strengthened after the latest readings on U.S. inflation and jobless claims, which bolstered bets on a moderate pace of interest-rate cuts ...

item.title: Get ready for Netflix price increases soon, analysts say
item.description: Netflix hasn’t raised prices on its standard plan in years, and analysts think the company’s strong upcoming content slate could support price hikes.

item.title: Jobless claims surge to highest level in more than a year
item.description: The number of Americans who applied for unemployment benefits surged by 33,000 to 258,000 in the week that ended Oct. 5, the Labor Department said Thu...

item.title: Social Security Is Giving Retirees a 2.5% Increase, the Smallest Raise in Years
item.description: Inflation has cooled, but the cost of living in retirement remains high.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Lower Ahead of Storage Data
